15  Source_base::Source_base() :
16  depth_pub(nullptr), rgb_pub(nullptr) {
17  //std::cout << "camera Source_base node constructed\n";

20 
21  Source_base::~Source_base() {
22  for (auto& x : thread_list) {
23  if (x.get_id() != boost::thread::id()) {
24  x.interrupt();
25  }
26  }
27 
28  for (auto& x : thread_list) {
29  if (!x.try_join_for(boost::chrono::milliseconds(100))) {
30  std::cout << ("failed to join a thread\n");
31  }
32  }
33 
34  p.stop();
35  delete[] depth_pub;
36  delete[] rgb_pub;
37  std::cout << ("camera source base node destrcuted\n");
38  };

40 
41  void Source_base::initialize() {
42 
43  std::cout << "Initializing source...\n";
44 
45  initCamera();
46  definePublishers();
47  setParamTimeOfStart();
48 
49  for (int i = 0; i < diversity; ++i) {
50  align_to_color.emplace_back(RS2_STREAM_COLOR);
51  }
52 
53  launchThreads();
54 
55  std::cout << "Source initialized!\n";
56  }

58 
59  Source_base& Source_base::definePublishers() {
60 
61  ros::NodeHandle& private_handle = getMyPrivateNodeHandle();
62  ros::NodeHandle& handle = getMyNodeHandle();
63 
64  if (!private_handle.getParam("diversity", diversity)) {
65  std::cout << "No parameter for source channel diversity specified, will use default: " << diversity << "\n";
66  } else {
67  std::cout << "Number of source channel diversity: " << diversity << "\n";
68  }
69 
70  depth_pub = new ros::Publisher[diversity];
71  rgb_pub = new ros::Publisher[diversity];
72 
73  //define publishers
74  const std::string s_d("depth");
75  const std::string s_rgb("RGB");
76  for (int i = 0; i < diversity; i++) {
77  std::cout << "creating publisher #" << i << "\n";
78  depth_pub[i] = handle.advertise<sensor_msgs::Image>(s_d + std::to_string(i), 8);
79  rgb_pub[i] = handle.advertise<sensor_msgs::Image>(s_rgb + std::to_string(i), 8);
80  }
81 
82  std::cout << ("Publishers defined\n");
83  return *this;
84  }
85 
86 
87  Source_base& Source_base::initCamera() {
88 
89  ros::NodeHandle& private_handle = getMyPrivateNodeHandle();
90 
91  //get align param
92  if (!private_handle.getParam("align", enable_align)) {
93  std::cout << "No parameter for alignment on/off specified, will use default value "
94  << (enable_align ? "ON\n" : "OFF\n");
95  } else {
96  std::cout << "Depth alignment is turned " << (enable_align ? "ON\n" : "OFF\n");
97  }
98 
99  //get FPS param
100  if (!private_handle.getParam("FPS", FPS)) {
101  std::cout << "No parameter for source FPS specified, will use default value " << FPS << "\n";
102  } else {
103  std::cout << "Source camera frame-per-second set to " << FPS << "\n";
104  }
105 
106  //check FPS validity
107  if (camera::Legal_FPS.find(FPS) == camera::Legal_FPS.end()) {
108  //std::set<T>.find(xxx) returns std::set<T>.end() if xxx is not found
109  std::cout << "FPS value is illegal, will use default FPS = " << (FPS = camera::Default_FPS) << "\n";
110  }
111 
112  if (FPS > 60) {
113  std::cout << "Warning: Per Intel RS 435 documentation, the maximum supported FPS for RGB stream is 60. Source will automatically capture RGB frames at 60 Hz\n";
114  }
115 
116 
117  //configure and initialize the camera
118  //according to Intel RS documentation, the max FPS of rgb stream is 60
119  c.enable_stream(RS2_STREAM_DEPTH, 640, 480, RS2_FORMAT_Z16, FPS);
120  c.enable_stream(RS2_STREAM_COLOR, 640, 480, RS2_FORMAT_RGB8, (FPS > 60) ? 60 : FPS);
121 
122  //let the camera start working
123  try {
124  p.start(c);
125  }
126  catch (rs2::error& err) {
127  std::cout << "Caught rs2::error, failed_function=" << err.get_failed_function() << ", message= "
128  << err.what() << "\n";
129  }
130 
131  std::cout << ("Device started\n");
132 
133  return *this;
134  }
135 
136 
137  Source_base& Source_base::setParamTimeOfStart() {
138  //set a parameter that describes the time stamp of starting in microseconds
139  ros::NodeHandle& handle = getMyNodeHandle();
140 
141  std::string time_of_start = helper::get_time_stamp_str();
142  handle.setParam("rs_start_time", time_of_start);
143 
144  std::cout << "Time-of-start set up as parameter \"rs_start_time\", value is " << time_of_start
145  << "\n";
146 
147  return *this;
148  }
149 
150 
151  void Source_base::kernelRoutine() {
152 
153  //this interruption point is where the thread will exit when the destructor wants to kill a thread that is running this routine
154  boost::this_thread::interruption_point();
155 
156  unsigned int second; //"second" part of Realsense timestamp
157  unsigned int nanosecond; //"nanosecond" part of Realsense timestamp
158  double frame_timestamp; //the original Realsense timestamp
159 
160  sensor_msgs::Image depth_msg;
161  sensor_msgs::Image rgb_msg;
162 
163  rs2::frameset frames;
164 
165  //Use lock to ensure multi-thread safety
166  boost::unique_lock<boost::mutex> seq_lock(seq_mutex);
167 
168  frames = p.wait_for_frames();
169  uint32_t local_seq = seq;
170  ++seq;
171 
172  //after obtaining a frame and updating ther serial number, no need to keep the mutex locked
173  seq_lock.unlock();
174 
175  //do depth alignment if required
176  if (enable_align) {
177  frames = align_to_color.at(local_seq % diversity).process(frames);
178  }
179 
180  frame_timestamp = frames.get_timestamp(); //realsense timestamp in ms
181 
182  //we need to convert from millisecond to a [second-nanosecond] format
183  second = frame_timestamp / 1000;
184  nanosecond = (frame_timestamp - 1000 * (double) (second)) * 1000000; //obtain the "nanosecond" part. Need to convert "second" to double otherwise multiplying it by 1000 will likely overflow uint's range
185 
186  rs2::depth_frame depth = frames.get_depth_frame();
187  rs2::video_frame color = frames.get_color_frame();
188 
189  unsigned int width = depth.get_width();
190  unsigned int height = depth.get_height();
191 
192  unsigned int width_color = color.get_width();
193  unsigned int height_color = color.get_height();
194 
195  unsigned int pixel_amount = width * height;
196  unsigned int pixel_amount_color = width_color * height_color;
197 
198  uint8_t* pixel_ptr = (uint8_t*) (depth.get_data());
199  uint8_t* pixel_ptr_color = (uint8_t*) (color.get_data());
200 
201 
202  //As for the size of the vector, since depth image is of mono16 format, one pixel corresponds to 2 bytes;
203  //RGB is of rgb8 format, where one pixel is consisted of 3 channels, 1 byte for each channel leads to a total of 3 bytes/pixel.
204  //The type of sensor_msgs::Image.data is std::vector<uint8_t>
205  //Reference: https://docs.ros.org/diamondback/api/sensor_msgs/html/Image_8h_source.html
206  depth_msg.data = std::vector<uint8_t>(pixel_ptr, pixel_ptr + 2 * pixel_amount);
207  rgb_msg.data = std::vector<uint8_t>(pixel_ptr_color, pixel_ptr_color + 3 * pixel_amount_color);
208 
209  //prepare rest of the part of sensor_msgs::Image
210  depth_msg.header.frame_id = std::to_string(local_seq);//this is the sequence number since start of the programme
211  depth_msg.header.stamp.sec = second;
212  depth_msg.header.stamp.nsec = nanosecond;
213  depth_msg.height = height;
214  depth_msg.width = width;
215  depth_msg.encoding = sensor_msgs::image_encodings::MONO16;
216  depth_msg.step = width * 2; //each pixel is 2 bytes; so step, which stands for row length in bytes, should be two times "width".
217 
218  rgb_msg.header.frame_id = std::to_string(local_seq);
219  rgb_msg.header.stamp.sec = second;
220  rgb_msg.header.stamp.nsec = nanosecond;
221  rgb_msg.height = height_color;
222  rgb_msg.width = width_color;
223  rgb_msg.encoding = sensor_msgs::image_encodings::RGB8;
224  rgb_msg.step = width_color * 3;//each pixel is 3 bytes - red, green, and blue
225 
226  //publish to one of the publishers
227  //TODO: can we strictly allocate a specific publisher to each thread in Source_nodelet::launchThreads?
228  depth_pub[local_seq % diversity].publish(depth_msg);
229  rgb_pub[local_seq % diversity].publish(rgb_msg);
230  }
231 
232 
233  void Source_base::launchThreads() {
234  //define lambda which will be launched in parallel
235  auto infinite_loop = [&]() {
236  try {
237  while (1) this->kernelRoutine();
238  }
239 
240  catch (boost::thread_interrupted&) {
241  return;
242  }
243  };
244 
245  for (int i = 0; i < diversity; i++) {
246  thread_list.emplace_back(infinite_loop);
247  }
248  }
249 
250 }
